definition: a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
metallic reed/spring of lock
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
lit. to sing a duet/fig. to collaborate with sb/also used satirically: to play second fiddle to

sentences.english: The oboist is well known for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 這位雙簧管吹奏者以即興演奏而著名。

sentences.english: Like to play flute and oboe .
sentences.chinese: 愛好長笛和雙簧管演奏。

sentences.english: Quartet for Flute, Oboe, Cello and Harpsichord.
sentences.chinese: 長笛四重奏，雙簧管，大提琴和大鍵琴。

sentences.english: The oboe and cello sat alone , echoing tone for tone.
sentences.chinese: 雙簧管和大提琴雙重奏，音調此起彼伏。

sentences.english: I encourage oboe and clarinet players to use plenty of vibrato .
sentences.chinese: 我鼓勵演奏雙簧管和單簧管的樂手們多使用顫音。

sentences.english: The oboist is well know for his improvisation.
sentences.chinese: 這位雙簧管吹奏者以即興演奏而著名。

sentences.english: She has taken up the oboe .
The oboe is a double reed wind instrument.
sentences.chinese: 雙簧管是一個具有兩片簧片的管樂器。

sentences.english: Out performs outlasts traditional single knife-edge doors.
sentences.chinese: 比傳統單刀雙簧屏蔽門更加持久的屏蔽效能。

sentences.english: The double bass and the oboe have different timbres.
sentences.chinese: 雙簧管與低音提琴的音色不同。

sentences.english: Wind instruments include the piri (cylindrical oboe), taepyeongso (metal-bell shawm), daegeumsaenghwang (mouth organ) and the hun (ocarina).
sentences.chinese: 管樂器包括圓柱形雙簧管，金屬蘆笛，口琴和陶笛。

definition: improvisation
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in northeast China
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end

definition: When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
reckless/extremely daring
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
Heaven knows!
masquerade
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to make a fool of oneself
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
